document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Australian species of Ecnomina Kimmins and Daternomina Neboiss (Trichoptera: Ecnomidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Australian species of Ecnomina Kimmins and Daternomina Neboiss (Trichoptera: Ecnomidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ecnomina irrorata Kimmins
in
Mosely and Kimmins, 1953: 385
, fig. 264. —
Neboiss 1977: 57
, figs 257–260. —
Neboiss 1986:153
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Daternomina irrorata
is distinguished by the long, fused inferior appendages, with a relatively shallow notch apically.

Description. Head, body and wings brown; wings shown in Fig. 1 . Forewing length about 2.8–2.9 times width: male 4.0– 5.6 mm , female 5.0–6.0 mm. Forewing fork 2 relatively long, sessile, about 1.6–1.7 times length of fork 3, nygma present; fork 3 about 1.7–2.7 times length footstalk, footstalk length about 1.5–2.2 times length cross-vein m; r-m and m displaced at fork 3 by about 1.1–1.6 times length cross-vein m; fork 4 length similar to fork 3; fork 5 long, about 1.8 times length of fork 4. Hindwing length about 3 times width; fork 2 with short footstalk, length footstalk 0.3–0.7 times length cross-vein r-m, fork 2 about 1.4–1.8 times length of fork 3.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 31–39.
Daternomina spp.
Male genitalia in lateral, ventral and dorsal views. 31–33:
Daternomina irrorata (Kimmins)
. 34–36:
Daternomina merga (Neboiss)
. 37–39:
Daternomina scindens (Neboiss)
.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type material (not seen):
Holotype male
, Tasmania , Deloraine ,
26–27 Dec 1884
, McLachlan Collection. ( BMNH ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Material examined: Tasmania . 1 male (specimen PT-1158 figured), 1 female (specimen PT-1159 figured), Huon-Picton jn, 18 Feb 1967 , A.N. (NMV); 1 male , 4 females , 43°07'S 146°47'E , Edwards Rd, Hartz Mtns, 4 Feb 1983 , J.C. Cardale (ANIC). Other Tasmanian records refer to Neboiss (1977 , 2003 ). Victoria . 1 male , 3 females , Scrubby Valley Ck, Grampians, 12 Jan 1982 , A.W.; 8 males , Fyans Ck, 16 km S of Halls Gap, 14 Dec 1966 , A.N.; 3 males , Wannon R., Serra Rd bridge, 25 km S of Halls Gap, 4 Dec 1983 , A.N.; 5 males , 3 females , Gellibrand R. at Asplin Ck jn, 28 Jan 1982 , A.N.; 7 males , 12 females , Charleys Ck, 5 km S of Gellibrand, Victree pine plantation, 29 Jan 1982 , A.N.; 5 females , Lardners Ck, 4 km SE of Gellibrand, Jackson Track, 26 Jan 1982 , A.N.; 2 females , Upper Carlisle R., 8 km SSW of Gellibrand, 27 Jan 1982 , A.N.; 1 female , Aire R., Hopetoun Falls, 4 km S of Beech Forest, 28 Jan 1982 , A.N; 1 female , Yan Yean Res. Remarks.
Daternomina irrorata
is common and widespread in Tasmania and Victoria (latitudinal range 36°08' - 43°00'S ). Kimmins’ (in Mosely and Kimmins 1953 ) and Neboiss’s (1977, 2003) figures have been redrawn to allow direct comparisons and to accompany the description that is revised in light of new interpretations of
Daternomina
genitalic and wing structures.
